column4: Breakingviews - China’s oil giants brace for electric car crash
column5: HONG KONG (Reuters Breakingviews) - China's moves to slash reliance on the internal combustion engine signal tough times for the country's oil majors. A push into new energy vehicles (NEVs) – including battery-powered and hybrid cars – could curb demand for black gold. Sinopec and PetroChina will be hardest hit. The policy will also add to downward pressure on global crude prices.

column4: Breakingviews - HSBC’s next challenge is how to grow responsibly
column5: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Edmund Burke  a father of modern conservatism  emphasised the principle of gradual change over revolutionary fervour. HSBC will have demonstrated the same values if John Flint  head of retail banking and wealth management  replaces Stuart Gulliver when he steps down as chief executive next year. The consummate company man  who has spent nearly three decades at the sprawling Asia-focused lender  is awaiting approval from regulators  according to the Sunday Times.
